name: Canyon Runner

topics.response_text: I see you bear the Mark of{KAI-zar}Caesar! Cursor{Luh-CUL-us}Lucullus awaits you at the docks!

topics.topic_text: Could we go lower than 300 caps?
topics.response_text: {scoffing}This isn't the total we agreed upon. Don't waste my time, wastelander.
{good-humored}No, no, no - they haven't yet earned the right to be called "slaves"! Those three in the pen are captures, nothing more.

topics.topic: Topic007<SPEECH - player tells CR the daughter has an incurable STD>
topics.topic_text: <Lie> Any fool can see that girl has all the symptoms of Pustular Hypomyalgia!
topics.response_text: [SUCCEEDED]{alarmed, trouble pronouncing it}Pustulah  what? Is that contagious? That doesn't sound good at all!
A fair price. Always best to have caps on hand in case traders stop by.

topics.topic_text: I'll give you 150 caps for the lot.
topics.response_text: Seems I'm fortunate to get that much for them, given the circumstances!{DUPLICATE?}

topics.topic_text: It doesn't bother you, enslaving people?
topics.response_text: {the player's ignorance is almost comical}Why would it bother me to enslave these wretches? They have no purpose, no creed, no honor.

topics.topic_text: I'll come back if I want to buy them.
topics.response_text: Please do. An outbreak of{trouble pronouncing it}pustulah-whatever is the last thing we need.

topics.topic_text: How much would it cost to buy the three "captures"?
topics.response_text: It's a weak bunch, to be honest. I'd rather have extra currency to buy supplies or better captures off traders.
Let me know if you change your mind.

topics.topic_text: I'll give you 150 caps for the lot.
topics.response_text: Seems I'm fortunate to get that much for them, given the circumstances!{DUPLICATE?}

topics.topic_text: How did the Legion set up a camp on this side of the river?
topics.response_text: It was easy. The Colorado is narrow here, and when the Profligates abandoned Searchlight, there was no one to guard the crossing.

topics.topic_text: How did you join Caesar's Legion?
topics.response_text: {proudly}I have Blackfoot in me, the first tribe that{KAI-zar}Caesar ever led in battle - the tribe that formed the Legion.
The best Cursor in the Legion. You'll reach Fortification Hill without incident, that's for sure.

topics.topic_text: Do you have any "captures" with the last name, "Weathers?"
topics.response_text: {patiently explaining}Captures lose any claim to the names they called themselves when they let themselves be taken.

description:
Canyon Runner is a 38 year-old Hispanic Male.

A zealous slavemaster in Caesar's Legion stationed at Cottonwood Cove. Canyon Runner is a hardened veteran who specializes in assessing and breaking captives before they are sent to Legion territories across the Colorado River.

Canyon Runner's Personality: Fiercely loyal to Caesar and the Legion's ideology. Canyon Runner is pragmatic, disciplined, and takes pride in his work. He views enslavement as a form of salvation that gives purpose to those he considers weak or degenerate. He grows impatient with difficult captives and would prefer to sell them for caps when given the opportunity.

Canyon Runner's Backstory: Born into the Blackfoot tribe, Canyon Runner was one of the first to follow Caesar when he began forming his Legion. He proved his loyalty and combat prowess time and again, gradually climbing through the ranks. His skill in breaking captives earned him the position of slavemaster, a role he embraced with fervent belief in the Legion's mission to conquer and 'civilize' the wasteland through strength and submission.
